main event: An unidentified flying object was observed near Greater Pittsburgh Airport on September 30, 1950.
interesting points: The object was described as round with a diameter of 50 ft,It was first spotted at an altitude of 2,000 to 2,500 ft climbing to 20,000 ft in 5 minutes,The object hovered briefly before climbing out of sight to the east at a speed of 50-60 mph,Its estimated rate of climb was about 5,000 ft per minute,There were no photographs taken of the object.
witness description: Lt James A. Frazier and Paul Raymon, military personnel on duty at the airport
